thread.title: SUV stolen at Quarry Park North: South Euclid police blotter
thread.title_full: SUV stolen at Quarry Park North: South Euclid police blotter | cleveland.com

author: Ryllie Danylko, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: SUV stolen at Quarry Park North: South Euclid police blotter
text:
Vehicle theft, South Belvoir Boulevard: At 5:45 p.m. Sept. 27, a woman reported that she was walking her dog in Quarry Park North when three teenage girls approached her and admired her dog. She noticed about 10 minutes later that her car keys were broken off her key chain, and that her blue 2014 Honda CRV was missing. The woman's purse, containing her credit cards, driver's license and $150 were inside the car.
Fire, Cedar Road: At 5:55 p.m. Sept. 27, a dumpster outside Chipotle in the Cedar Center North Plaza caught fire. The dumpster is located in a gated area outside the store, and the items that caught fire were cardboard boxes, paper and linen laundry. Police also found cigarette butts in the debris, which may have caused the fire. Police think the fire was accidental. No damage was reported.
Shoplifting, Warrensville Center Road: At 2:39 p.m. Sept. 26, police cited a woman who is accused of stealing about $38 of merchandise, including pants and toys, from Walmart.
Disorderly conduct, Verona Road: At 11:27 p.m. Sept. 26, police were called to a report of a loud party and found a man lying in the grass. The man, a college student, was highly intoxicated. He was turned over to his roommate and issued a citation for disorderly conduct.
Domestic violence, Argonne Road: At 10:25 p.m. Sept. 26, a woman reported that her daughter's friend, a 16-year-old girl, was assaulted by her mother. Investigators found that the girl had been punched by her mother, but was not seriously hurt. The mother was charged with domestic violence.
Shoplifting, Warrensville Center Road: At 11:38 p.m. Sept. 25, police arrested a man who is accused of trying to steal about $200 worth of speakers from Walmart. He was taken to the hospital after he complained of nausea and chest pains during his arrest. He is charged with theft.
Burglary, Harwood Road: At 8 a.m. Sept. 25, a woman reported that someone came into her house and stole a tablet, a charger and clothing. She told police she saw an open door when she came home.
